workflow.name: Complete LAMP stack (Linux, Apache, MySQL, PHP) automated server setup
workflow.description:
This automated n8n workflow enables the rapid setup of a complete LAMP (Linux, Apache, MySQL, PHP) stack on a Linux server, executing the entire process in approximately 10 seconds. It configures the server, installs necessary components, and sets up a development user for seamless operation.

## Fundamental Aspects
- **Start** - Initiates the workflow
- **Set Parameters** - Configures server parameters
- **System Preparation** - Prepares the system for LAMP installation
- **Update System** - Updates the system and installs essential packages
- **Install Apache** - Sets up the Apache web server
- **Install MySQL** - Installs MySQL and phpMyAdmin
- **Install PHP & Extensions** - Installs PHP with required extensions
- **Install Development Tools** - Adds development utilities
- **Create Development User** - Creates a dedicated user for development
- **Final Setup & Configuration** - Finalizes configurations
- **Setup Completion** - Provides a summary of the setup

## Setup Instructions
- Import the workflow into n8n
- Configure parameters in the Set Parameters node
- Run the workflow
- Verify the LAMP stack setup on the server

## Required Resources
- Linux server with SSH access
- Root-level administrative privileges

## Features
- Install Database Server - Deploys MySQL with phpMyAdmin
- Configure Web Server - Sets up Apache for web hosting
- Install PHP - Includes PHP with essential extensions
- Create Development User - Establishes a user for development tasks

## Parameters to Configure
- server_host: Your Linux server IP address
- server_user: SSH username (typically 'root')
- server_password: SSH password
- php_extensions: List of PHP extensions to install
- dev_tools: List of development tools to install
- username: Development username
- user_password: Password for the development user

## Workflow Actions
- Install: Deploys the LAMP stack, configures Apache, MySQL, and PHP
- Create User: Sets up a development user with appropriate permissions
- Configure: Finalizes server settings and tool installations

## The workflow automatically manages
- Ubuntu/Debian package installation
- Service startup and configuration
- Web server and database setup
- User and permission management
- Development tool integration

Update the parameters in the "Set Parameters" node with your server specifics and run the workflow!

workflow.name: Automate Complete LAMP Stack Setup on Linux Server in Just 10 Seconds

parameters.command:
#!/bin/bash
set -e

echo "üöÄ Starting LAMP Stack Setup..."
echo "=============================="

# Update system
echo "üì¶ Updating system packages..."
export DEBIAN_FRONTEND=noninteractive
apt update -y && apt upgrade -y

# Install essential tools
echo "üîß Installing essential tools..."
apt install -y curl wget git vim nano software-properties-common apt-transport-https ca-certificates gnupg lsb-release unzip

echo "‚úÖ System preparation completed!"

#!/bin/bash
set -e

echo "üåê Installing Apache Web Server..."
echo "=================================="

# Install Apache
apt install -y apache2

# Enable modules
a2enmod rewrite
a2enmod ssl
a2enmod headers
a2enmod deflate

# Start and enable Apache
systemctl start apache2
systemctl enable apache2

# Configure Apache
echo "ServerName {{ $json.domain_name }}" >> /etc/apache2/apache2.conf

# Create virtual host
cat > /etc/apache2/sites-available/{{ $json.domain_name }}.conf << 'EOF'
<VirtualHost *:80>
    ServerName {{ $json.domain_name }}
    DocumentRoot /var/www/html
    ErrorLog ${APACHE_LOG_DIR}/error.log
    CustomLog ${APACHE_LOG_DIR}/access.log combined
    
    <Directory /var/www/html>
        Options Indexes FollowSymLinks
        AllowOverride All
        Require all granted
    </Directory>
</VirtualHost>
EOF

# Enable site and restart Apache
a2ensite {{ $json.domain_name }}.conf
systemctl reload apache2

echo "Apache version: $(apache2 -v | head -n 1)"
echo "‚úÖ Apache installed and configured!"

#!/bin/bash
set -e

echo "üê¨ Installing MySQL Database Server..."
echo "====================================="

# Pre-configure MySQL root password
echo "mysql-server mysql-server/root_password password {{ $json.mysql_root_password }}" | debconf-set-selections
echo "mysql-server mysql-server/root_password_again password {{ $json.mysql_root_password }}" | debconf-set-selections

# Install MySQL
apt install -y mysql-server mysql-client

# Start and enable MySQL
systemctl start mysql
systemctl enable mysql

# Secure MySQL installation
mysql -u root -p{{ $json.mysql_root_password }} -e "DELETE FROM mysql.user WHERE User='';"
mysql -u root -p{{ $json.mysql_root_password }} -e "DELETE FROM mysql.user WHERE User='root' AND Host NOT IN ('localhost', '127.0.0.1', '::1');"
mysql -u root -p{{ $json.mysql_root_password }} -e "DROP DATABASE IF EXISTS test;"
mysql -u root -p{{ $json.mysql_root_password }} -e "DELETE FROM mysql.db WHERE Db='test' OR Db='test\_%';"
mysql -u root -p{{ $json.mysql_root_password }} -e "FLUSH PRIVILEGES;"

# Create development database
mysql -u root -p{{ $json.mysql_root_password }} -e "CREATE DATABASE IF NOT EXISTS lamp_dev;"

# Install phpMyAdmin
export DEBIAN_FRONTEND=noninteractive
echo "phpmyadmin phpmyadmin/dbconfig-install boolean true" | debconf-set-selections
echo "phpmyadmin phpmyadmin/app-password-confirm password {{ $json.mysql_root_password }}" | debconf-set-selections
echo "phpmyadmin phpmyadmin/mysql/admin-pass password {{ $json.mysql_root_password }}" | debconf-set-selections
echo "phpmyadmin phpmyadmin/mysql/app-pass password {{ $json.mysql_root_password }}" | debconf-set-selections
echo "phpmyadmin phpmyadmin/reconfigure-webserver multiselect apache2" | debconf-set-selections

apt install -y phpmyadmin

# Configure phpMyAdmin
echo "Include /etc/phpmyadmin/apache.conf" >> /etc/apache2/apache2.conf
systemctl reload apache2

echo "MySQL version: $(mysql --version)"
echo "‚úÖ MySQL and phpMyAdmin installed!"

#!/bin/bash
set -e

echo "üêò Installing PHP and Extensions..."
echo "=================================="

# Add PHP repository
add-apt-repository -y ppa:ondrej/php
apt update

# Install PHP and common extensions
apt install -y php{{ $json.php_version }} php{{ $json.php_version }}-fpm php{{ $json.php_version }}-mysql php{{ $json.php_version }}-curl php{{ $json.php_version }}-gd php{{ $json.php_version }}-mbstring php{{ $json.php_version }}-xml php{{ $json.php_version }}-zip php{{ $json.php_version }}-intl php{{ $json.php_version }}-bcmath php{{ $json.php_version }}-json php{{ $json.php_version }}-imagick php{{ $json.php_version }}-dev

# Install Composer
curl -sS https://getcomposer.org/installer | php
mv composer.phar /usr/local/bin/composer
chmod +x /usr/local/bin/composer

# Configure PHP
php_ini=/etc/php/{{ $json.php_version }}/apache2/php.ini
sed -i 's/upload_max_filesize = 2M/upload_max_filesize = 100M/' $php_ini
sed -i 's/post_max_size = 8M/post_max_size = 100M/' $php_ini
sed -i 's/max_execution_time = 30/max_execution_time = 300/' $php_ini
sed -i 's/memory_limit = 128M/memory_limit = 512M/' $php_ini

# Enable PHP modules
a2enmod php{{ $json.php_version }}

# Restart Apache
systemctl restart apache2

echo "PHP version: $(php --version | head -n 1)"
echo "Composer version: $(composer --version)"
echo "‚úÖ PHP and extensions installed!"

#!/bin/bash
set -e

echo "üõ†Ô∏è Installing Development Tools..."
echo "=================================="

# Install Node.js and npm (for modern web development)
curl -fsSL https://deb.nodesource.com/setup_20.x | bash -
apt install -y nodejs

# Install development tools
apt install -y git vim nano htop tree

# Install VS Code Server (code-server)
curl -fsSL https://code-server.dev/install.sh | sh

# Install additional PHP tools
composer global require laravel/installer
composer global require symfony/cli

# Install WP-CLI for WordPress development
curl -O https://raw.githubusercontent.com/wp-cli/builds/gh-pages/phar/wp-cli.phar
chmod +x wp-cli.phar
mv wp-cli.phar /usr/local/bin/wp

echo "Node.js version: $(node --version)"
echo "npm version: $(npm --version)"
echo "‚úÖ Development tools installed!"

#!/bin/bash
set -e

echo "üë§ Creating Development User..."
echo "=============================="

# Create user
useradd -m -s /bin/bash {{ $json.username }}
echo "{{ $json.username }}:{{ $json.user_password }}" | chpasswd
usermod -aG sudo,www-data {{ $json.username }}

# Create project directories
su - {{ $json.username }} -c "mkdir -p ~/projects/{php,laravel,wordpress,html}"
su - {{ $json.username }} -c "mkdir -p ~/backups ~/scripts"

# Set up Git
su - {{ $json.username }} -c "git config --global user.name '{{ $json.username }}'"
su - {{ $json.username }} -c "git config --global user.email '{{ $json.username }}@example.com'"

# Generate SSH key
su - {{ $json.username }} -c "ssh-keygen -t rsa -b 4096 -C '{{ $json.username }}@lamp-dev' -N '' -f ~/.ssh/id_rsa"

# Set permissions for web directory
chown -R {{ $json.username }}:www-data /var/www/html
chmod -R 755 /var/www/html

echo "‚úÖ Development user created!"

#!/bin/bash set -e echo "üîß Final Configuration..." echo "========================" # Configure firewall ufw --force enable ufw allow 22/tcp # SSH ufw allow 80/tcp # HTTP ufw allow 443/tcp # HTTPS ufw allow 3000/tcp # Development server # Create sample PHP info page cat > /var/www/html/info.php << 'EOF' EOF # Create sample index page cat > /var/www/html/index.php << 'EOF' LAMP Stack - Welcome

üöÄ LAMP Stack Setup Complete!

‚úÖ Server Status: All services running successfully!

Server Information

Server: {{ $json.domain_name }}
PHP Version:
Apache Version:
MySQL Status:

Quick Links

üìä PHP Info

üóÑÔ∏è phpMyAdmin

Next Steps

  • Upload your PHP applications to /var/www/html/
  • Use phpMyAdmin to manage your databases
  • SSH as user: {{ $json.username }} (password: {{ $json.user_password }})
EOF # Set proper permissions chown -R {{ $json.username }}:www-data /var/www/html chmod -R 755 /var/www/html # Create environment file cat > /home/{{ $json.username }}/.env.example << 'EOF' # Database Configuration DB_HOST=localhost DB_NAME=lamp_dev DB_USER=root DB_PASSWORD={{ $json.mysql_root_password }} # Server Configuration SERVER_NAME={{ $json.domain_name }} DOCUMENT_ROOT=/var/www/html # Development DEBUG=true ENVIRONMENT=development EOF echo "üéâ LAMP Stack Setup Complete!" echo "============================" echo "üìä Installation Summary:" echo "‚Ä¢ Apache: $(apache2 -v | head -n 1 | cut -d' ' -f3)" echo "‚Ä¢ MySQL: $(mysql --version | cut -d' ' -f3)" echo "‚Ä¢ PHP: $(php --version | head -n 1 | cut -d' ' -f2)" echo "‚Ä¢ Domain: {{ $json.domain_name }}" echo "‚Ä¢ Web Root: /var/www/html" echo "‚Ä¢ Dev User: {{ $json.username }}" echo "‚Ä¢ MySQL Root Password: {{ $json.mysql_root_password }}" echo "" echo "üåê Access your server at: http://{{ $json.domain_name }}" echo "üóÑÔ∏è phpMyAdmin: http://{{ $json.domain_name }}/phpmyadmin" echo "üìä PHP Info: http://{{ $json.domain_name }}/info.php" echo "Happy coding! üéØ"

user.name: Oneclick AI Squad
user.bio: The AI Squad Initiative is a pioneering effort to build, automate and scale AI-powered workflows using n8n.io. Our mission is to help individuals and businesses integrate AI agents seamlessly into their daily operations  from automating tasks and enhancing productivity to creating innovative, intelligent solutions. We design modular, reusable AI workflow templates that empower creators, developers and teams to supercharge their automation with minimal effort and maximum impact.
